FACS sorting of glioma initiating cells

FACS sorting sample sheet

Sample Name + cell number Sample Name + cell number Sample Name + cell number
1 PI control................................................. 5 ................................................................. 9 .................................................................
2 Isotype control......................................... 6 ................................................................. 10 .................................................................
3 CD133 control........................................... 7 ................................................................. 11 .................................................................
4 ................................................................. 8 ................................................................. 12 .................................................................

Materials

  • Complete media for sample collection
  • FACS buffer. Store this buffer cold
    1. Dulbecco's PBS - 50mL
    2. 1% Fetal Calf Serum (FCS) - 500uL
    3. 2mM EDTA - 200uL of 0.5M
    4. Propidium Iodide - add just before sort
  • 45uM cell strainer
  • FACS tubes
  • Accutase
  • Wash buffer - DMEM/F12 + Pen/ Strep
  • CD133-APC conjugate antibody (AC133 #130-098-829)
  • Isotype control Keyhole limpet hemocyanin (not expressed in humans) BD Bio340442

Procedure for neurosphere dissociation

Work quickly and on ice to maximise viability.

  1. Pipette cells in dishes into 50mL falcon tube. Rinse empty wells with some wash buffer and add to tube.
  2. Spin 300xg for 1 minute in a centrifuge at room temp.
  3. Resuspend in 5mL wash buffer and spin at 300g again.
  4. Resuspend in 1 - 3mL accutase as appropriate for cell number
  5. Incubate at room temp for 2x 5 minutes, resuspending cells with a pipette in between.
  6. Dilute accutase with 4mL FACS buffer (cold). Put through 45uM cell strainer into a fresh 50mL tube. Pipette some FACS buffer first to wet the membrane
  7. Take 20uL for a trypan blue count and record cell number on sample sheet.
  8. Spin down at 500xg at 4°C for 5 minutes.
  9. Resuspend in 100uL FACS buffer and transfer to a FACS tube. Add 5uL (1:21) CD133 antibody or isotype control.
  10. Incubate for 20 minutes in the dark in the fridge (dark).
  11. Wash with 1mL of FACS buffer and centrifuge for 500xg at 4°C for 5 minutes.
  12. Resuspend in a sufficient amount minimum 1mL of FACS buffer for FACS sorting. Aim for 5 - 10 million cells per mL.
  13. Before sorting add 1:20 of 1mg/mL (final 5ug/mL) PI to each tube. This is 50uL of Iwan's buffer.

FACS sorting

  1. Use the 100uM nozzle for less pressure through the sorter.
  2. Prepare a collection tube filled with 500uL complete media per sample.
  3. Be sure to run the PI, isotype control and CD133 positive control first.
Written by Daniel V Brown 03 June 2013
